availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel Farrer (Madison County, farm laborer and soldier)

body.p: Madison County, Kentucky, farm laborer and soldier. Madison County native. Son of Rebecca Farrer. Resident in Madison County in 1850. Farm laborer in Madison County in 1860. Served in the 1st Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as private from October 1861 to December 31, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, District 2, p. 278B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Madison County, Western Subdivision 2, p. 114.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 4.
